content.description: Start with a right heel hook, its all funky. It get pretty reachy when you try to get out of the divot. Good holds, great quality granite.
content.protection: Crash pad optional. The route cruises pretty close to a flat boulder landing that could cause some pain.
content.location: (THERE IS NO PRIVATE PROPERTY TO WORRY ABOUT IN THIS AREA, DISREGARD THE OTHER WARNING) From the top of the steep S curve on the road in, walk West on the offroad trail that is to the south side of the huge boulder next to the road for about 70 feet. Hang a right and walk to the West facing side of a very large boulder which is cracked in two with some bits of rope hanging from where they meet at the top. It will be the boulder facing Sap Drop on your immediate left if standing next to the crack.

content.description: Flake. Mossy towards the top on the left side. Down climb is the large crack which identifies this boulder.
content.protection: Crash pad or two, the landing is sloped pretty steep.
content.location: (THERE IS NO PRIVATE PROPERTY TO WORRY ABOUT IN THIS AREA, DISREGARD THE OTHER WARNING) From the top of the steep S curve on the road in, walk West on the offroad trail that is to the south side of the huge boulder next to the road for about 70 feet. Hang a right and walk to the West facing side of a very large boulder which is cracked in two with some bits of rope hanging from where they meet at the top. The flake is on the Northwest side of this boulder.

content.description: Overhang start. Not so good rock quality on the under belly but you wont be there for long. Still needs some good cleaning. Mostly good holds.
content.location: (THERE IS NO PRIVATE PROPERTY TO WORRY ABOUT IN THIS AREA, DISREGARD THE OTHER WARNING) The very south west corner of this boulder city, immediately next to a cow pasture. There are cows present, and they may appear mad. Can be accessed from the West via Olivas Ave. Route faces West.
